Name: Harper Lee
Biography: Harper Lee was an American novelist, widely known for her novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird,' which won the Pulitzer Prize and became a classic of modern American literature.

Name: George Orwell
Biography: George Orwell, born Eric Arthur Blair, was an English novelist and essayist known for his works '1984' and 'Animal Farm,' which are considered classics of dystopian literature.

Name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Biography: F. Scott Fitzgerald was an American novelist and short story writer, famous for his novel 'The Great Gatsby,' capturing the spirit of the Jazz Age in the United States.

Name: J.K. Rowling
Biography: J.K. Rowling is a British author, best known for the 'Harry Potter' series. Her books have gained immense popularity worldwide and have been adapted into successful film franchises.

Name: J.D. Salinger
Biography: J.D. Salinger was an American author known for his influential novel 'The Catcher in the Rye,' which explores the experiences of a disenchanted teenager named Holden Caulfield.
